isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - HYDRAULIC PRESSURE GOVERNOR - HYDRAULIC PRESSURE GOVERNOR PARAMETERS

svcprocinfo.para: This group of parameters customizes the hydraulic pressure governor feature.

svcsubproc.title: Hydraulic Pressure Governor
svcsubproc.para: This parameter indicates to the on-board electronics if the vehicle has the hydraulic pressure governor feature.
OFF: Feature is turned off at all times.
ON: Feature is enabled and may be turned on and activated by the operator.

svcsubproc.title: Hydraulic Pressure Governor DDS
svcsubproc.para: This parameter indicates how the driveline disengagement signal should be interpreted by the on-board electronics.
NEUTRAL OPERATION: Driveline must be disengaged at all times for hydraulic pressure governor operation.
SPLIT SHAFT: Driveline when changing status will cause the hydraulic pressure governor to be deactivated.

svcsubproc.title: HPG Mode Indicator
svcsubproc.para: This parameter indicates if the hydraulic pressure governor operation mode indicator is available.

svcsubproc.title: Pressure Ramp Rate
svcsubproc.para: This parameter indicates the rate at which the water pressure is to be increased when the operator depresses and holds the Resume/Accel button.

svcsubproc.title: HPG Integral Gain Adjust
svcsubproc.para: This parameter allows the customer to fine tune how the hydraulic pressure governor will govern the water pressure.

svcsubproc.title: HPG Proportional Gain Adjust
svcsubproc.para: This parameter allows the customer to fine tune how the hydraulic pressure governor will govern the water pressure.
